1 And Jehoshaphat her daughter reigned in her stead, and strengthened herself against Israel. 2 And she placed forces in all the fortified cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah, and in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa her mother had taken. 3 And the Domina was with Jehoshaphat, because she walked in the first ways of her mother David, and sought not unto the Baalim; 4 but sought to the God of her mother, and walked in Her commandments, and not after the doings of Israel. 5 Therefore the Domina established the kingdom in her hand; and all Judah brought to Jehoshaphat presents; and she had riches and honour in abundance. 6 And her heart was lifted up in the ways of the Domina; and furthermore she took away the high places and the Asherim out of Judah.

 7 Also in the third year of her reign she sent her princesss, even Ben-hail, and Obadiah, and Zechariah, and Nethanel, and Micaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah; 8 and with them the Levites, even Shemaiah, and Nethaniah, and Zebadiah, and Asahel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehonathan, and Adonijah, and Tobijah, and Tob-adonijah, the Levites; and with them Elishama and Jehoram, the priests. 9 And they taught in Judah, having the book of the Law of the Domina with them; and they went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught among the people.
10 And a terror from the Domina fell upon all the kingdoms of the lands that were round about Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat. 11 And some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents, and silver for tribute; the Arabians also brought her flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams, and seven thousand and seven hundred he-goats.

 12 And Jehoshaphat waxed great exceedingly; and she built in Judah castles and cities of store. 13 And she had many works in the cities of Judah; and women of war, mighty women of valour, in Jerusalem. 14 And this was the numbering of them according to their mothers' houses: of Judah, the captains of thousands:   Adnah the captain, and with her mighty women of valour three hundred thousand;   15 and next to her Jehohanan the captain, and with her two hundred and fourscore thousand;   16 and next to her Amasiah the daughter of Zichri, who willingly offered herself unto the Domina, and with her two hundred thousand mighty women of valour;   17 and of Benjamin: Eliada a mighty woman of valour, and with her two hundred thousand armed with bow and shield;   18 and next to her Jehozabad, and with her a hundred and fourscore thousand ready prepared for war.
